page.title: 01SOUTH-WEST OF SHREWSBURY
page.content: The block is a rural area.The industry is either farming or trades connected with the land. People not working in the area travel into Shrewsbury to work either by bus,car or motorcycle. There is only one major settlement which is Pontesbury. The other small areas of habitation have grown from the times when the manors controlled the land. There is very little property development allowed in this area. The area has little or no amenities although the population enjoys a reasonably active and interesting life. Unemployment is low and social functions held in the various village halls are well supported.One has a daily playgroup for under fives, a luncheon club for the elderly,the amateur dramatic club,a weekly youth club besides the scout and guide meets
